title: Offer Item

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: life cycle status
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: Status associated with offer life cycle.

items.title: Frequency capping constraint
items.description: Frequency capping constraint define additional rules based on prior offer proposition, either across all audiences or for a particular profile identity.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: Limit
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: How many times an option can be proposed.

meta:enum.global: Global cap is a constraint on how many times an option can be proposed in totality.
meta:enum.profile: Profile cap is a constraint on how many times an option can be proposed to a certain profile.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: Events
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: Events of the capping to comply with. Since most of the events don't support offerId level counting, we will start with only support decisioning event, and will extend to support custom event in future phases. Other events to be supported in the future : web-display, web-click, message-delivery, message-open, message-click.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: Custom PQL query
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: Custom PQL query to match events.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: Repeat
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: When true, new counter rule with updated time window will be created. Configure a capping to be repeated (e.g., max times every 1 week). ECS will support repeating config in the rules, scan rules daily, and create a new rule with new expiry when the rule is due for repeating.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: Enabled
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: If set to true ECS will created new counter rules with updated time window.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: Unit
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: Unit to comply with.  It will be day/week/month.
